intro: Patersonia lanata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed paterson's curse, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along waterways. It is an annual or biennial herb that can reach heights of up to 60 cm, with a fibrous root system and a branching stem. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated, but it can also become invasive in certain environments.
